dmca.title: Notice of Copyright Infringement
dmca.body:
-----Original Message-----
From: Morris, Lashonda [mailto:Lashonda.Morris@pearsoned.com] 
Sent: Tuesday, February 28, 2006 3:23 PM
To: 'copyright@theplanet.com'
Subject: Notice of Copyright Infringement

NOTICE OF COPYRIGHT INFRINGEMENT

Date: February 28, 2006
 
George Poletes
ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc.
1333 Stemmons Freeway, Ste. 110
Dallas, TX   75207
e-mail: copyright@theplanet.com <mailto:copyright@theplanet.com> 
 
Dear Sir:
 
I, the undersigned, CERTIFY UNDER PENALTY OF PERJURY that I am an agent
authorized to act on behalf of the owner of certain intellectual property
rights, said owner being named Pearson Education, Inc. ("IP Owner"). 

I have a good faith belief that the items or materials identified herein are
not authorized by the above IP Owner, its agent, or the law and therefore
infringe the IP Owner's rights according to state, federal, or United States
law. Please act expeditiously to remove or disable access to the items or
materials claimed to be infringing.
 
I may be contacted at:
Printed Name:  LaShonda Morris
Title & Company:  Pearson Education, Inc.
Street Address:  One Lake Street
City and State and Zip:  Upper Saddle River, NJ 07458 Email
(correspondence):  Lashonda.Morris@pearsoned.com Email (ended auction
inquiries)*:  Lashonda.Morris@pearsoned.com
Telephone:  201-236-5803
Fax:  201-236-3400
Date:  February 27, 2006

Truthfully,
LaShonda Morris
My name, typed above, constitutes an electronic signature under Federal Law,
and is intended to be binding.
_________________
Signed
Printed Name: LaShonda Morris
 

A.        Infringer:        
                www.betah.co.il <www.betah.co.il> 
                Rita Gemelfarb
                3/25 Urugvai
                Jerusalem  96701
                Israel
                Email: ritagi2000@yahoo.com <mailto:ritagi2000@yahoo.com> ;
info@betah.co.il <mailto:info@betah.co.il> 

B.        Site reproduces and distributes unauthorized digital copies of
approximately 18 Pearson works, examples of which are specified below:

C.        Infringing Materials:
http://www.betah.co.il/bookscatalog.aspx?category=programming
<http://www.betah.co.il/bookscatalog.aspx?category=programming>   
        
1.  Core Java(tm) 2, Volume I-Fundamentals by Cay Horstmann and Gary Cornell
ISBN: 0-13-089468-0

2.  XML How to Program, First Edition by Deitel
ISBN: 0130284173 

3.  Java How to Program, Fourth Edition by Deitel
ISBN: 0130341517 

4.  Core Techniques and Algorithms in Game Programming by Daniel
Sanchez-Crespo Dalmau
ISBN: 0131020099 

5.  Servlets and JSP: The J2EE Web Tier by Jayson Falkner and Kevin R Jones
ISBN: 0321136497 

6.  MDA Distilled: Principles of Model-Driven Architecture by Stephen J.
Mellor
ISBN: 0201788918 

7.  Windows System Programming, Third Edition by Johnson M. Hart
ISBN: 0321256190 

8.  SWT: The Standard Widget Toolkit, Volume 1 (The Eclipse Series) by Steve
Northover and Mike Wilson 

9.  Imperfect C++: Practical Solutions for Real-Life Programming by Matthew
Wilson
ISBN: 0321228774 

10.  Extreme Programming Explained: Embrace Change, Second Edition by Kent
Beck and Cynthia Andres
ISBN: 0321278658 

11.  JDBC(tm) API Tutorial and Reference by Maydene Fisher, et. al. 
ISBN: 032117384-8 

12.  C++ Template Metaprogramming : Concepts, Tools, and Techniques from
Boost and Beyond by David Abrahams and Aleksey Gurtovoy 

13.  C++ Coding Standards: 101 Rules, Guidelines, and Best Practices by Herb
Sutter and Andrei Alexandrescu
ISBN: 0321113586 

14.  Find the Bug: A Book of Incorrect Programs by Adam Barr
ISBN: 0321223918 

15.  eXtreme .NET: Introducing eXtreme Programming Techniques to .NET
Developers by Neil Roodyn
ISBN: 0321303636 

16.  Sams Teach Yourself the C# Language in 21 Days by Bradley L. Jones
ISBN: 0672325462 

17.  A Programmer's Introduction to Visual Basic .NET by Craig Utley
ISBN: 0672322641 

18.  The C Programming Language, Second Edition by Brian W. Kernighan,
ISBN: 0131103628
